thread.title: Jamie Vardy needs to stop diving, Gareth Southgate likes a tinker and England fans let themselves down… And that’s the naked truth
thread.title_full: Jamie Vardy needs to stop diving, Gareth Southgate likes a tinker and England fans let themselves down… And that’s the naked truth

author: gstonehouse
title: Jamie Vardy needs to stop diving, Gareth Southgate likes a tinker and England fans let themselves down… And that’s the naked truth
text:
EFL FIVE THINGS WE LEARNT Jamie Vardy needs to stop diving, Gareth Southgate likes a tinker and England fans let themselves down… And that’s the naked truth 
Lukas Podolski downed the Three Lions for Germany… but here’s some things you may have missed By Gary Stonehouse 22nd March 2017, 10:05 pm Updated: 22nd March 2017, 11:24 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ENGLAND were undone by a Lukas Podolski strike as they lost 1-0 to Germany in Dortmund on Wednesday. 
The former Arsenal man bowed out of international football with a thunderous strike that befitted the tributes to him prior to kick off in his farewell game. Getty Images England were undone by a thunderous Lukas Podolski strike against Germany Getty Images Lukas Podolski scored the only goal of the game as the Three Lions were defeated 1-0 in Dortmund 
Despite the setback there were some positives for Gareth Southgate’s Three Lions. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest England squad news, gossip and rumours 
But, as ever with England , there were also a number of disappointments – but this time they were not all on the pitch. 
Here’s five things we learnt from England’s defeat in Germany : MOST READ IN FOOTBALL FA plan tribute to security services and victims against Lithuania on Sunday after terror attack BAK TO THE FUTURE Chelsea 'have agreed a contract' with Monaco rising star Tiemoue Bakayoko, says Guillem Balague Team news Jake Livemore and Michael Keane start for England in Germany as Gareth Southgate experiments with 3-4-3 new look Jake Livermore starts and Michael Keane makes debut as England boss Gareth Southgate tries out 3-4-3 experiment BIG HART Joe Hart shows incredible sportsmanship as he fist bumps Lukas Podolski after German scores screamer NEVER MOVED SO FAST Manchester United flop Bastian Schweinsteiger is seen moving out of Cheshire mansion just one day after MLS switch is announced JAMIE VARDY IS NOT HELPING HIS REPUTATION 
The Leicester City striker is right back in form for his club and looked lively for the Three Lions throughout his time on the pitch – but he needs to cut out the diving. 
Just seven minutes were on the clock when he raced onto Dele Alli’s pass, toeing the ball around keeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen, before going to ground. Rex Features Jamie Vardy went down under the challenge of keeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen on seven minutes, despite no contact being made Rex Features The German defence were not happy with the Leicester striker, who is getting quite the reputation for diving 
The referee clearly saw there was no contact and waved away the penalty appeals. 
Vardy was guilty of the same thing on several occasions during the Foxes’ Champions League clash against Valencia. 
He needs to cut it out or risk losing the admiration he gained during his and Leicester’s remarkable campaign last season. Reuters Gareth Southgate will have been encouraged by how his three-man defence performed Rex Features Chris Smalling, Gary Cahill and Michael Keane did not allow Germany a single shot on target in the first half Getty Images Gareth Southgate is proving to be quite experimental with his England line-ups ENGLAND ARE LEARNING FAST 
Gareth Southgate was very much Mr Versatile during his playing days, equally comfortable in midfield, as part of a back four or equally a back three. 
And he is showing the same attitude in his tactics with England, and although it is still not perfect, he will be encouraged by the start his men made. 
He opted to line up with three at the back on this occasion, with debutant Michael Keane alongside Chris Smalling and Gary Cahill. 
It worked wonders in the opening 45 minutes, as the visitors did not allow the visitors a single shot on target. And although they were eventually undone, Joe Hart will not get beaten by many better strikes than Podolski’s. EPA Kick off between Germany and England was delayed by eight minutes Getty Images A number of pre-match tributes were paid to Lukas Podolski in Dortmund Reuters And Lukas Podolski even made a goodbye speech before the action got underway GERMANS ARE ALWAYS EFFICIENT 
The game had been scheduled to kick off at 7.45pm – but the action did not start until 7.53pm thanks to Podolski. 
The game was being used as tribute to 31-year-old forward after he announced his international retirement… And boy did he milk it. Ex-Arsenal star Lukas Podolski is a rap king after song gets number one in Germany 
After a montage of his highlights for his country was played beforehand, Poldi then went on to drag his speech out to ensure the actual match got underway EIGHT MINUTES late. 
But never fear, despite several stoppages during the opening half, the German organisers no doubt gave the fourth official a nudge to ensure his colleague in charge blew his whistle dead on 45 minutes to get the schedule back on track. AP:Associated Press A number of England fans let themselves down again during the away clash in Dortmund Rex Features A large section of the away support could be heard singing 'Ten German Bombers' ENGLAND FANS CONTINUE TO LET THEMSELVES DOWN 
Once again England fans embarrassed themselves with the chant of ‘Ten German Bombers’ throughout the first half in Dortmund. 
The Football Association rely heavily on the Official England Band to drown out such chants at Wembley, but even they were powerless to mask the idiotic supporters singing the tune. 
Now, ‘Don’t Take Me Home’ ran its course after last year’s Euros, but it says something when you are praying for it to be belted out instead of the moronic reference to the Second World War. Naked England football fan dances in the stands as his team take on Germany AND THAT’S THE BARE NAKED TRUTH 
It was not only the singing that let the travelling support down. 
A video emerged during the game of one individual who had clearly had too much – and just felt the need to take his clothes off! 
England fans are renowned and even revered around the world for their passion, but there is always a few that want to spoil that.
